<!-- Structured Program Details Below the Image -->
  <h3 style="text-align: center; font-weight: bold;">Background</h3>
  <p style="text-align: center;">Paratyphoid fever is caused by Salmonella Paratyphi A and is a neglected tropical disease affecting millions globally, especially in low- and middle-income countries. Our tool, Paratype, assists in epidemiological studies of paratyphoid fever.</p>

  <h3 style="text-align: center; font-weight: bold;">Method</h3>
  <ul style="list-style-type: none; padding: 0;">
    <li>1. Phylogenetic analysis using RAxML to detect potentially novel genotypes from newly published genomes.</li>
    <li>2. Enhancements in Paratype to allow batch processing for large datasets (Figure 1).</li>
    <li>3. Updated Paratype v1.1 and scripts uploaded to GitHub for public use.</li>
  </ul>

  <h3 style="text-align: center; font-weight: bold;">Results</h3>
  <ul style="list-style-type: none; padding: 0;">
    <li>Analyses of 479 new genomes using Paratype v1.1 from different countries (India, Bangladesh, Cambodia, etc.).</li>
    <li>Six novel genotypes were identified: 2.3.4, 2.4.5, 2.4.6, 2.4.7, 2.4.8, and 2.4.9 (Figure 2).</li>
    <li>Paratype v1.1 was released on GitHub with updated allele information.</li>
  </ul>

  <h3 style="text-align: center; font-weight: bold;">Conclusion</h3>
  <p style="text-align: center;">Paratype v1.1 will assist in future genomic studies on Salmonella Paratyphi A, and its installation from Bioconda will allow greater accessibility. Genomes from paratyphoid-endemic regions like sub-Saharan Africa will help improve the genotyping scheme and support targeted treatment strategies.</p>

<script>
  let slideIndex = 0;
  const slides = document.querySelectorAll('.mySlides');
  
  function showSlides() {
    slides.forEach((slide) => {
      slide.style.opacity = '0';  // Hide all slides
    });
    slideIndex++;
    if (slideIndex > slides.length) { slideIndex = 1; }  // Loop back to first slide
    slides[slideIndex - 1].style.opacity = '1';  // Show the current slide
    setTimeout(showSlides, 3000);  // Change image every 3 seconds
  }

  document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function() {
    showSlides();  // Initialize the slideshow
  });
</script>
